result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jalen R Nichols

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 19 pages) commencing 10-20-2022 by Linda L. Duchrow.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Van Grunsven.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Crivello, Br. 36.

Defendant Jalen R Nichols in court in person.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court in person for Jalen R Nichols.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: M. Leeman.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jalen R Nichols appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Jalen R Nichols.  Prosecuting Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense requests a hearing. Due to the lateness of the hour Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jalen R Nichols in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant would like to retain private counsel. Attorney Sargent remains Attorney of record for now. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with Mayfair Mall.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jalen R Nichols in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Jalen R Nichols in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
